reporting-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands

title.narrative: NDE Empowering women to prevent violence

description.narrative: Women and girls in Assam, as in other parts of India, suffer from multiple disadvantages. Assam ranks highest in recorded crimes against women (rape, witch-hunting, dowry deaths, abuse by husband/in-laws, trafficking), displays a high gender-gap in par-ticipation in public bodies, indicating deep-seated gender bias. Intimate partner violence(48.86%) accounts for highest number of cases of crime against Assam’s women, followed by kidnap-ping(25.53%), molestation(16.87%) and rape(7.77%) [Assam Police; 2018]. Sonitpur district registers among the highest hu-man trafficking cases in the state[NCRB, 2018]. Assam ranks third highest on gender-gap in economic participation [economic participation 11.5% for rural women] with significant conse-quences on violence and discrimination that women have to suffer. The project seeks to enhance capacity of women and girls for prevention of violence in remote rural communities in Sonitpur district, Assam, India. It would develop leadership capacity and confidence in women to prevent violence through access to peer support and local level mentorship for 3000 women and girls. It would create avenues for information and economic opportuni-ties via local empowerment centres for women. These would educate them on legal provisions and supports for women, train them in potential vocations, and enable them through necessary linkages for input supplies and marketing to access their eco-nomic rights. Informed women with capacity for enhanced finan-cial contributions to their households would possess increased bargaining power at home, which would in turn reduce their vul-nerability to domestic violence. Financial autonomy via sustaina-ble livelihood options would also enable women to escape abu-sive relationships and to support themselves and their children.
